title: What would you do if a person ignores your text message? - Quora

response.answer_text: I get kind of touchy about this subject. Unless it was in the middle of a conversation and they just up and stopped talking, I usually won’t respond with anything. If I want to keep talking to them, I’ll try to make a comment based on the last thing I texted, but usually won’t go further than doing that once, maybe twice if the issue is really pressing. I’ll leave it for a day, and if they don’t respond, I figure the conversation is done, and the next time I talk to them, I start a new conversation. Why I’m so careful about this is because I used to have a friend with super bad clinginess issues. If I didn’t respond to his text within an hour, even if the conversation was over, he would start freaking out. It’d start with ”Hello?” Then maybe 30 minutes would pass. ”Hello??” 30 more minutes.”Hello..” 30 minutes. “You there…?” Slowly getting more and more depressed, as if I was purposefully ignoring him instead of, oh, I don’t know, being in school? His clinginess and subtle guilt tripping whenver I was too busy having a life that didn’t revolve around him really bugged me. It bothered me so much that I started feeling guilty whenever I was busy doing things and couldn’t constantly be on the internet. Which is wrong. No one should make you feel guilty for having your own life, or for doing things that don’t involve them. Anyway, it got really, really annoying and quite frankly kind of suffocating, to the point where I eventually never wanted to talk to him. Call me paranoid, but I don’t want to make someone else feel like that. So I’m careful about over-texting. The only time I get a little impatient with waiting for someone else to respond is (NERD ALERT) when I’m roleplaying with someone over text. I absolutely love doing fantasy D&D-style rpgs, and text roleplay is kind of another form of that. So when my rp buddy goes silent on the rp for a while, I usually send them irritating or goofy messages to try to subtly remind them that I still want to roleplay. I still do try to keep it lighthearted and low-pressure, because it’s supposed to be fun, and I don’t want to make it a chore for them to have to respond.

Instead of saying what I'd do... I'll tell you what one shouldn't do..  Don't sit and over think... you probably came to this conclusion, that they're ignoring, just by over thinking... Don't keep sending them texts, asking about the obvious.. if they're ignoring, they are not interested in talking to you... leave it at that... Repeated asking of the reason is not gonna make you more interesting...  Do not feel bad about yourself..Give them space.. respect their decision...  by doing so,  you free their mind off of 'you'... sometimes this might make them contact you back ... if not for a chat, at least for saying what was the problem first of all...Don't talk about it to others..that's  not gonna do you any good... it could make it worse... Do not judge them... you never know what is going on with them.. what you thought of as   ignoring cud be due to some genuine reasons of not being able to contact you.. After all this if you are so sure that they're definitely ignoring you, then deep down, if you think properly, you already know the reason for doing so... find it and think what you should do to make things better... Be positive and feel happy about all the special people in your life... even if you are not one to them, be happy that you met them and you liked something about them that you value them so much... that'll keep you going... :D

For a multitude of reasons… I can think of a few… Because it’s not urgent and they are busy and concentrated in something else right now, but they will respond laterBecause the text made them feel uncomfortable and they prefer to avoid answering rather than respond something you won’t feel good seeing and they won’t feel good writingBecause they haven’t figured out what to answer yetBecause they know they will see you soon and the answer will be easier given in personBecause they feel the text is somehow a demand for attention from you and they don’t want to give you it (in other words you’re bugging them)Because they haven’t seen it yetBecause they hate that form of communication and never answer that wayDepending on the situation, it can a bit rude not to answer… but there are situations where it does happen for legitimate reasons… a text sent to someone can feel respectful and a normal part of a relationship and communication but it can also feel the equivalent of someone tugging on your sleeve and talking to you while you’re already in a conversation with someone else… it can be insistent and demanding… like an unwelcomed hand reaching through space poking you to demand attention, sometimes at a time when it’s inconvenient for you to answer. We can usually guess pretty accurately why the person isn’t answering based on the relationship we have with them…

Attraction requires attention. In order for you to have any chance with a woman you have to get her attention. If you don’t have that you are pretty much dead to her. Men think that the worst things a woman can do is be mean to you but it’s not because there is some attention there even though it is negative. You may be able to turn that negative attention into positive attention and win her over. However what the worst thing a woman can do to you in terms of showing that she doesn’t care about you is indifference. If a woman is indifferent towards you then you do nothing to her emotionally. Being that women are emotional beings that is not a good sign. With all that said, no attention means no interest. If I were you I would just move on and find some other women to talk to. Most women won’t be mean and reject you out right so they do things like ignore your text, calls, flake on you, etc. Just take the hint and move on. No need to approach her and ask her why she hasn’t responded to your text. Be the bigger person and find a woman who won’t ignore your text and give you the attention that you want. Choose women who choose you! No need to waste time chasing women who simply aren’t interested in you because you can never get that time back. Hope that helps. Your Dating Coach, Jacob.

I own a phone to serve me - not other people. It’s not that I’m terribly busy and important - it’s just that I don’t like to be disturbed in the middle of a project that requires focus and concentration. For reasons that I have never understood, my retired friends seem to think that I have nothing better to do than engage in nonsensical chitchat. If you are family, this is true. If you’re just some random person I know trying to kill time while you wait for something else to happen, then you’re a nuisance and I ignore it, according to my personal policy that my time is not yours to kill. Also I don’t understand people who have emergencies. If you have a flat tire, you call AAA. Why text me? If you think you’re having a heart attack, you dial 911. You don’t text a friend. There was one recent exception - a 90-year-old neighbor with a baby opossum trapped in a wastebasket. She was afraid of being bitten, so I walked over and put the baby out in the yard where its mama could hear it calling. Mama came and got it and all was well. That really was an emergency for my friend. But mainly I use my phone for my own purposes.

This question reminds me of my son. Once we were having a digital conversation and for whatever reason, I stopped responding. The next time I looked at my phone I saw that he’d texted, “Good talk, Ma.” I do love his sardonic wit. I laughed out loud but also regretted that I hadn’t replied to his last question or comment. He’s done this a few times since, although not so much that the joke has become old. How you respond to a lack of a response in text depends upon the kind of relationship you have with the person you’ve texted. My closest others and I have an implicit (in some cases, explicit) understanding that if we don’t reply to a text, we are probably super busy, down, simply not in the mood, or sleeping. With those who are less close and with whom I text infrequently, I make it a point to reply within a reasonable period of time. If they don’t reply within a couple of days, I’ll wait to have the conversation until whenever they do reply or when we next speak. If I’ve never texted with someone, and I’ve texted first and received no reply, I let it go. Some people don’t particularly like to text and others have no particular interest in texting with me. It’s not a big deal. With people you don’t know well, the reply to the lack of a reply is no reply. They’ll get back to you if they want to.

This depends on the person personally if it was my friend i wouldn't text again especially if they left me on read but obviously sometimes things happen in life that people cant even be on their phone. i have a friend i have known since primary school and i recently met him in a shop he worked at and this was the first time in 10 years that i saw him. we texted for a bit but the last text i sent him was “how you been during lock down?” he did not reply for months which i was scared i said something wrong or he did not wanna speak to me again but then i texted him and then we spoke again but i did not mention about why he did not text back because it can feel like pressuring people to reply. i know how u feel but my advise is that if you feel like this person has recently started slowly texting or does not seem interested in talking then maybe try change up the conversation to make it more lively? (Do this if you have the energy to deal with this person or you like this person) Also check back to the last few messages you sent to this person and see how they might of felt about it. not sure if my advise is good but its here

It's going to depend on the original reason for reaching out to them. Is it a personal matter? Business related? Casual conversation? If you're reaching out about something that's time sensitive, maybe ask if there's a platform they respond quicker on. Call me old fashioned but you can always call them and save a lot of time. If it's just making plans to hangout or to catch up, give them space and respect that some people use their phone less often and technically have no obligation to respond right away, every time. I know this is anecdotal evidence but I have a friend that is terrible for carrying a text conversation if it's not about anything important. Once every few weeks we may have a phone call to catch up or check in with each other and talk for an hour or two. That's just our relationship. Some friends I have we just text each other frequently to make plans or joke about some meme or something. All in all, it's going to vary person to person. Don't have the same expectations for everyone.

The best thing NOT to do is take it personally. Not yet, anyway. Electronic messaging is not as foolproof as we like to think it is. It’s not at all uncommon for someone not to get a message. So, the first thing I would do is send it again. Even if they did get it the first time, it could have slipped through the cracks. With me, if something doesn’t have a deadline, it tends to get moved to the back burner and I sometimes forget that back burner is there. So a resend would nudge me and get me to respond. Did you indicate you wanted a response? Because if you didn’t, they might not have seen a reason to respond, especially if it’s a guy. If your message did require a response and if the person did receive it and chose not to respond, then I’d ask them why. I wouldn’t jump to any conclusions, I’d get the information first. If it comes down to it, you’ll have to deal with the reality that this person does not want to communicate with you. That’s life.

So ok I'm a prideful guy and all and there's certain things I wouldn't do but sometimes some shit got you all pissed and you have to bend your own rules. The screenshot shown below is of a conversation I was having with this girl who obviously i don't speak to anymore for obvious reasons. I don't remember how I got her number but I believe it was one of them new contacts things I don't remember or either a friend gave it to me or something but like she was tripping and stuff giving attitude and stuff and being the type of guy that's confident and all knowing that I'm damn well good looking I snapped when she left me on read. So a friend told me this trick to get back that them by saying "hey guess what ", now try typing it as entertaining as possible or as simple as above and it would definitely prompt a reply which you in turn leave them on read or un read and enjoy the satisfaction. I've used this trick only twice or so but I deleted some of my chats so the i lost the spicy ones.  Don't mind my Grammer I'm a bit lazy to correctly check stuff.😪

Hey, I hit you up with a text a few days ago, not sure if you got it but (Insert your previous text here). If it’s important, call them. If they’re ignoring you. Ghost them for a while. If they come back with an apology and a reasonable excuse, decide whether or not that’s good enough for you, and act accordingly, but if they’re behaving as though they aren’t taking you seriously, you either turn up the heat on them, which means you’re not taking no for an answer and you run the risk of looking like a creepy stalker, or you leave them where you found them. Sometimes fate favors the bold. Sometimes not. It’s a calculated risk to go after a person who keeps you on their “pay no mind” list. You need to have a thick skin to take rejection if you continue to pursue a person who’s not recognizing your value. The best prediction of future behavior, is that of the recent past. If this is how they treat you now…..well you can fill in the blanks on that one. Having said all that, there are times when a person gets extremely busy and forgetful. As a rule I say give them a chance, two if it matters, and three strikes their out.

It’s very simple, call them out. Here are a few examples of things you can respond with - remember your relationship with the person you’re talking to, and use your judgement. Hey, did you get my text?Typical response: “Hey sorry, (Insert excuse for not replying)”Why didn’t you reply to my text?Probably the most direct and simple way of knowing why the person didn’t respond.Thanks for (not) replying!I put not in brackets because technically you can also say thanks for replying in a sarcastic way.I see you read my message…[finish this in the context]This one can be direct, but more polite or you can be indirect about it.You can literally respond however you want, but your goal should be to get the person’s attention without pissing them off.

Straightforward answer , the person is avoiding you and doesn’t want to talk to you , so just stop texting or connecting to the person . I don’t know what is the reason for it , but this person wants you out of their friend’s list . I hope not , because if he/she does , then this person can just delete you . Also , out of self respect , you have to stop acting like you are desperate to connect because if the person still wants to talk to you , he/she will do the reconnecting . Find other worthwhile things to do than worrying about someone who is ignoring you despite your trying to be in their circle of friends . But for me , I will just take it as a sign that I am not wanted and have to disconnect myself after the third time I don’t get a response for my messages . Moving on with life and finding better friends instead that are worthy of my time and effort .

Different people have different banner and alert notifications. Even my most faithful text companions occasionally doesn’t see a message come in because they’re doing something. If I don’t get a response to my first text in what I know is a reasonable amount of time, I send a second message. Something like – did you see my message? If I’m texting with a friend I wait longer after the second one And if I still got no answer I send a third one that says- Are U OK? If I were texting with somebody I was Just getting to know I would wait 24 hours before the second one. If it was an older friend after the third one I’d call. If I don’t hear anything after three messages and 24 hours, I know something is up. The key thing is to text in a way that shows you care but, is not invasive or demanding. Showing you care by following up is caring but, Sending too many messages is “blowing up their phone”.

If someone didn't reply to your text, what do you text the person back with? It would depend on the circumstances. Some offices require their employees to keep their phones off during work hours. So do some doctors offices. Many government offices require visitors to turn off their phones. If they are driving, most states require drivers not to text. It can cause accidents. If they are in a concert hall, movie theater or any other theatrical venue, karaoke bar, etc., people don’t want to hear the ding of the phone. I have gotten texts when my phone was down or misplaced. If you have to text someone 24/7, you may have an addiction or stalking problem. Be reasonable about when you expect them to return a text. Recently, the Mom of an acquaintance had a stroke. You need to be sensitive to your friends needs and schedule. Otherwise, IMO, you aren’t being a very good friend.

Been a while, Henry! Hope all’s well with you, brother! Well, it depends. If I don’t know the person, then I’d just simply stop after 1–2 messages. They’re not responding for a reason, and I don’t feel it’s worth it to find out why; I’d just take the hint and skedaddle. If I did know the person, then I’d try to ask why and see if there was something I’d done that’d caused this behavior. If they either weren’t reciprocating or simply ignored me after my “mending the fences” attempt, then I’d amscray and leave them be in the future. When we message too much - or simply are attempting to contact someone that doesn’t want to hear from us - then we’re either being clingy or wasting time. Onto the next person, preferably someone that either likes us better or is willing to communicate when things go awry.

You don't text them!!!! I have seen this question numerous times in the last week, For the most part if you don't receive a text back it is best to let whatever it was you were talking about go for a bit. I'm not saying you should drop the subject but things happen people get busy, or forget to check their phones. They have lives and as much as it sucks to say this if they read your text and intentionally don't reply than you are better off without them. It take very little time to send a hey I'm busy text, or something of the sort. If you feel that it is important to get a reply my suggestion is not to hold whatever the conversation is over text. Leave the trivial what are you up tos and how are yous for text and discuss important things over phone call or even coffee.

That depends on the message. If you gave them information and they didn’t respond, let it go. If you asked a question and need the answer, call them. If you get their voice mail, you can expand on your original message. “Just a reminder about Saturday. If I don’t hear back from you by Thursday, I’ll assume it’s off and I’ll make other plans.” But if you were trying to start a conversation and didn’t get a reply, I’d just assume they were too busy to deal with it in the moment. Not everyone can stop what they’re doing to mess with their phones. Talk to them the next time you see them. If you want to address this, I’d go with “Hope I didn’t interrupt something important when I texted you last Monday” rather than “Why didn’t you answer my text?” but use your own words.

Hello, Let me answer in points so that you understand in no time Common reasons why people don`t respond quickly to your messages. They might be busy when you gave them a message. Sometimes people do read messages and they want to respond as well but they can`t due to urgent work.Their phone might get switched off.Their net may be slow.I feel is that we should not judge them but instead we should talk to them, care about then and be more understanding of one another. Common reasons why people NEVER respond to your messages. This might sound rude but trust me self-respect is more important than anything else. They don`t see you as their priorityThey don`t share a strong bond with youMany a times feelings change as well and sometimes it changes so drastically that it takes time to accept the truth.I just want to tell you that take it as an experience and I think experience is a gift which we should not ignore at all. Love and respect yourself and cut negative people from life no matter how much you love them. But remember we all have at least one person who genuinely wants us to progress in our life. So focus on this kind of people. Take care.

Get in touch with them one other way, e.g. email or phone message. It's possible that whatever they use for texting is lost or broken. If someone doesn't respond to both text and email, I leave him alone. I assume he doesn't want to relate to me or is having some sort of life crisis and needs to focus on that right now. Continuing to bother him won't likely have any sort of effect I'd want.

If someone hasn't responded to your text within 2–3 days, there are possibilities that the person has some kind of emergency or something. If you think that the person is repeatedly trying to ignore you, then the person might dislike you for some reason, he/she feels that you are inferior to them or some ‘’life changing’’ is happening with them or maybe they are just busy… If it’s a close friend or family member, you’d know something is wrong. Talk to the person in a way that shows you care for the person. if the person hasn’t responded, I just delete the contact of that person. If they don’t need us, we don’t need them. edit 1: okayy, 1.8k views?? This is my second answer in Quora and this means a lot… Thanks a lot guys

Well, if someone ignores my text, I wait. For me, the largest half of having a conversation is accurately saying what I want to say. The second half of that mix is being willing to hear the other person out. I’m willing to do both. The question isn’t what I will do. I have already done what I wanted to do. I reached out. The next move is out of my hands. So I wait. PS - I will add that the question said the text was ignored, so that indicates to me that it was read and there is no response. If no indication is available that it was truly ignored, I only know that I sent it but not that they have received it. My options then become try sending again or to continue the conversation in person.

upvoters.user_id: The Fair Haired Boy With The Red Balloon

response.answer_text: Mostly, relax, be patient, and busy yourself with something else while you wait. It depends on the person, and the subculture. I rarely check text messages. If you want to contact me you should normally call. The only reason to send me a text message is if you are sending me an address or phone number or short message of that sort, or if it is urgent, and I am in the wilderness far from cell towers. (Sometimes text gets through when a phone call won’t.) Today’s young people have different expectations. They get annoyed if you don’t respond in seconds or minutes. That’s silly, in my opinion. You might be outside shoveling snow or mowing the yard. You might be studying for a test or writing a term paper. Your phone’s battery might be dead. You might be driving. There are many reasons not to answer a text right away. Be a little patient, and relax.

Ahh!! Something everyone hates in this digital age is being left on seen, specially if it comes from someone you’ve been dying to talk to😅 been there, it was when I got used to talking to this guy and he out of no where went on a no communication mode. He wouldn’t reply to me nor would show any interest in conversation if he replied, if someone does it once once or twice it might not be intended but if it’s happening repeatedly then it’s by choice. Once you realise this, it would be a painful feeling but what can you do after all. I gathered all my courage sent him a message wished him good luck as I was aware of a big life event coming in his life just before we stopped talking and stopped all communication with him 😅

If it’s a guy I’m interested in I would not text more If this person is a friend I’ll probably text them something else later on .. if I had something to say or share. if I don’t have something to say I’ll check up on them later on to see how they’re doing. Sometimes I just leave it there. If they’re a parent or a loved one, a spouse.. And it’s been long I’d be concerned I’d just check up if they’re okay. probably I’d call if they don’t get back or receive my texts within a day. Especially a parent. if it’s a coworker or a manager and it’s urgent I’ll call or ask again for a response… if it’s not then well I won’t do anything and won’t even be concerned. now this is me and how I deal with it. I think you should find what fits you best :)

I been through this a lot with people, that I met. This is the most annoying thing, when they ignore my text and emails. Someone I knew, told me that he has ignore my text on purpose at times, cause of my views on communication and he has an issue with the whole Christian religion. If I feel ignore, I’m learning to just remove myself, and I realized that isn’t a friend, and especially after he mention to me, that he ignores my text. So I learn that it’s a game, it’s best to just don’t text them and move on with your life. No one needs that frustration and trying to figure out why they’re ignoring text, we have better things to do. 😃

I HATE PEOPLE WHO IGNORE TEXTS. i have the perfect solution. when they text me when they really need me ignore them for as long as they did to you. in case if im sure they wont ever need me i text them “lets ignore each other together” “but i guess im not matching your STANDARDS to do something together with you”. if its someone i like that wont reply to me- thats a tricky situation because that means they dont like me back so yeah i stop texting them at all if they text me back after a time i treat them like they treat me. there’s this friend i have that doesnt respond to my texts. after a while i stopped texting her so she texted me. dont text them too much or they’ll stop caring for your texts. -hummra

If you think they’ve missed it send another. If you’ve only just sent it wait for a response - not everyone sits on their phone. If you think they’re ignoring you it then depends on the relationship and why they might be ignoring you, for example if it’s a boyfriend/girlfriend and you’ve just had an argument or if it’s a relation / work colleague etc. Only you know if there could be a reason they’re ignoring you. If it’s a new love interest and you don’t hear for days / weeks sadly they may just may no longer be interested. If this is the case, don’t waste any more time on them, move on and find someone who does want to respond to your texts. Life is too short to waste any of it.

My natural response to literally anything is mirror it back + 1. Do ya like me? Well I loooove you. You ignore me once and you're dead to me. That’s what you do. If they come back groveling and apologetic, sorry, that’s what regret is for, for you to fix bullshit behavior. You wouldn’t be asking such questions if this person wasn’t a child. Nobody wants to date a child. For one they have nothing of substance to add to a conversation. Read into it past that and you deserve what’s coming.

If they are close to you, understand that they are busy and took the liberty of not texting you immediately hoping you would know.If it is someone whom you have not interacted with much, stop disturbing them more, ball is in their court to decide.Either way, do not lose your self respect and go about annoying the other person.

While it was an accident at first & not intentional, but this one worked. Once this happened where i was texting someone in WhatsApp and was eagerly waiting for the revert. There was no response for a while. I wanted to be harsh on this unresponsive behaviour and wrote something. I immediately thought that those words would be inappropriate and deleted the message. While there was no response for earlier messages, I got a reply the moment this message was deleted - ‘what did you write, why deleted?’ I actually learned that day that this method can work well at times and started using it once a while.i.e., when someone doesn't respond, write something and delete it. The curiosity of the recipient may get you a response, Bingo!

I would learn to not presume I was being ignored, as much as simply noting that someone did not reply to my message.  Makes life more comfortable. After that, I would either text again, or call, or move on to some other opportunity, depending on the relationship between us and the message I was hoping to communicate. Assuming everyone reads and replies to every message on every system where we get messages today is pretty crazy-making.

Nothing. I wait and if they don’t respond, I leave it like that. I don’t have the right to force anyone to answer me so… If that person doesn’t answer, I can’t do anything about it. I just leave it so if they respond, it’s fine and if they don’t - it is their choice after all.

Depending on who and what you are messaging, I would stop messaging and either call (if it's an important message like job related or an emergency) or just move on with my life. If someone just ignores your messages, respect their decision. Why worry about someone who isn't worried about you? Don't spend your valuable time waiting and getting upset. Keep moving and communicate with people who enjoy you and want to talk to you. If you're not worth someone else's time, don't waste your time on them.

Don't do anything for a reasonable time - a full day if there is no immediate deadline being discussed; maybe an hour if the text involves plans for that day. If your text didn't clearly require a response, don't do anything - wait until it makes sense to start a new conversation. If/when follow-up is appropriate, a quick way to get to the top of their texts is a simple ? That will remind them that they offer you an answer, without sounding hostile. Or you can say any of the things suggested in other answers. If the text was part of a big relationship talk, try “maybe this isn't a good time or way to talk about this. When would be a good time to talk?”

Stop talking to him or her, obviously. If a person is ignoring your texts it can mean two things: He/she is not wanting to talk to you.He/she is super busy and can't talk at the moment.For both the cases, you should stop texting and wait for the person to reply. You should only text back (if you want to) when he/she replies. References: “How to not be a nagging person 101”. “Guide to self respect 102”

To many unknown factors to determine the best response, Is this a friend, lover, family member, business partner, client, etc. I’m assuming a lover as that would be one of the only reasons one would care about a response. It really depends on what you sent last, but a good follow up text for a non responsive text is to mention what you are doing atm and ask what they are doing. This lessens the abruptness of some random question or neediness of asking why they didnt reply. However whats most important is to leave open ended text that way you wont be concerned with non responsive people unless they purposefully chose to not respond to you.

I had a friend who did that. Even though I know I probably didn't do anything to cause that response or lack thereof. I apologised saying “Not sure if I did anything to hurt or offend you why you don't respond when I text you. So I'll take the no response as a warning that I shouldn't text.” Those are my exact words. The person responded “Hey I don't want you to think u did anything to hurt or offend me.. because u didn't.” So from that response I just knew the friendship was over but I didn't know why and I guess they didn't want to say. So I left it. So I guess you could take my approach to see where it leads you.

First it depends on the relationship between you and and the receiver. if it is someone u can express yourself with let the person understand how u feel with it,he will surely reply and explain why he didn't reply previously. For someone u don't want to know how u feel about the snub given to your message. U can try this trick ,which is to send a greetings like Happy Sunday or anything that even an acquittance is expected to reply to. This is to know if u have said something the person didn't like or there is already a grudge and maybe just a matter of “no time yet to reply (cause it's long/stressful)”. For those P@. People just ignore them.let them do as they wish.

If someone ignores your messages over an over again, its clear that they are doing it by choice. They are doing this consciously . So you do the same. Accept the fact that this person does not wish to talk to you. And never text them back. If you want a proper closure, you may directly confront them about this. Mostly they will give you some lame reasons. Life is too short to bother about people who don’t even have the courtesy to reply. And it makes no sense to beg people to behave normally. So moving on is the best thing to do.

If you ask them a direct question, and they don’t say anything then they probably don’t like you lol.. so don’t text them anything because why would you want to talk to a person that doesn’t like you. If they didn’t respond to a comment, then if you really want, ask them why they’re not texting you, or even better ask them something else. Double texting a person who doesn’t like you will make them like you even less lol. The only time double texting is ok is if your friend, family member or bf/gf is mad at you, in which case you can be cute or resolved to continue texting them until they forgive you.

This depends on your relationship. There was this one boy, who when he didn't text back quick enough, I'd send all sorts of “thirsty" references, and joke at myself about being thirsty. He didn't keep me waiting very often, so that's why I could laugh about it. Apparently, he liked it, because one time, he waited like a whole day before I get a message, “I refuse to innitiate a conversation until you send me a thirsty thing, and this is not me being thirsty, I am only acting thirsty, and this is not me initiating a conversation, I am only initiating the initiation of a conversation.” He was cute and stubborn like that.

Depends on my knowledge or feeling of why my messages are being ignored. If its because i did something wrong that affected the other person adversely in anyway i would lend his feelings some time to tone down before making another attempt to apologise in the apt manner. If I feel that I am being looked down upon for no significant reason and there is no such meaningful business benefits I can get out of him, then hell with him I would rather leave it to reply for him without even waiting for it. If there is something to gain from him i won’t mind being ignored and be persuasive giving ample pauses between the messages.

The other day i texted a guy wanting some business info. He saw my message and didn’t reply. Two days later i texted “hey thanks for info! It was great”. Then a laughing emoji. He replied immediately and apologized that he had opened my message at work and forgot to reply. So in this case i used sarcasm to get a result and it worked. If i got ignored the second time i would have left it. I don’t go hounding people as it’s annoying but in this case it worked so you could try some light sarcasm or humour and see if it works. Don’t go in for the kill and be all stroppy. People do get busy and forget.

If someone didn't reply to your text, what do you text the person back with? Not everybody is into texting. If I text someone and they don’t respond, I might try calling or emailing them, or sending them a letter by postal mail. If I know that they do read texts, I’ll take it as a sign that they are not interested. It is a good idea to consider whether you are initiating conversation for your benefit or theirs. If you text me twice, I’ll block you. A text is an interruption. I value uninterrupted time.

It depends on how long it’s been since I sent them the text. It depends on who it is that I’ve sent the text to. It also depends on what I’ve sent them and whether there’s any urgency or not. I’d give them a reasonable time to reply. If I don’t hear from them, then I’d follow up. What I’d text back would, to some extent, depend on what the initial text is about. It could be any number of things. If it was someone I cared about, I would first ask them if they’re okay as I hadn’t heard back from them. Anything that’s formal, I wouldn’t do that; I’d just follow up in a professional capacity. Also, whether I’d text back at all would depend on whether I want to text back. It might not be important for me to.

It depends on the situation. People don't always jump up and run to the phone when they get a notification. My response half of the time is a cuss word. If I open it and see it can wait, I often forget to go back and answer it. If someone is asking me something I answer promptly. I might add I'm working and TTYL. If I don’t hear back from a friend in a couple days, my next text expresses my concern. Keep in mind that I can sit next to a ringing phone and not answer it. That drives people crazy. Remember the text you send is invading someone's space. There is no rule that I have to change my privacy to accomadate you.

I know it feels abit itchy when you dont get a reply back, cause same here. At that time you need to have a cool brain and think. You need to think about all possible circumstances like maybe the person is actually busy,pretending to be busy, or is ignoring, or maybe their phone died ,etc. Then u have to see ur dealing with which person. Is it your parents, or maybe your partner , siblings or best friends? If it is your parents u need to worry they are obviously busy and are not ignoring u . Atleast in 90% of the cases if it is ur friend or partner the other situations might arise. It's better to not reply and poke them at all. Or you could leave a “hey?”. If they still dont reply…ur not replying anymore from ur side. You are going to wait for a text or a call from their side. And if it is your sibling, just rebuke them😂 Have a good day

according the person and the situation. I know the situation first, then I act. For example,if he/she didn’t respond because he/she was busy, it’s okay. But if this always happens, then this person have to give me from his/her time so that I still feel his/her respect to me. Another example, maybe this person naturally(personality) don’t respond to anyone when he/she gets angry, whether from me or something else. So, it’s according to the situation an the person.

When I text my youngest son, he will usually reply almost immediately. Unless he has an overseas assignment, he may delay replying which is understandable. When he does not reply to my text, if it is just to chat, I’ll just let it be. If it is to confirm something such as whether he’ll make it for a family event, I’ll follow up with another text. Finally, if I still don’t get a response, I will give him a call.

Depending on the subject, never care or even try to look while im driving. If its sumthing i need an answer to, ill ask again. If that doesnt work ill let them off the hook. “if u get a few minutes later, holla. If not we will check back with each other.Stay safe.” this lets us both off the hook. One thing Ive learned about texting, it can be taken the wrong way very easily. What you may be thinking is a funny lil poke at somebody, they may take it offensively. So it can be touch n go depending on the people doing the texting. If i take a text offensively, ill make a point of asking if they meant it that way & more times than not, they did not mean it that way. Its best to give the benefit of the doubt.

As most things in life there are few absolute answers without a context. This answer will depend on the relationship between the person and the importance of that relationship to you. If it is a casual relationship give them the benefit of doubt and assume they will get back when they have the time or desire to respond. If it is an important relationship to you, but not an intimate one, I recommend a follow-up but keep it calm and non-emotional. If it a close family member then a follow-up might be a bit more emotional, such as, "did I do something to hurt your feelings?”

I live in an area of the country where cell service can drop unexpectedly, depending on the road you’re driving down, or what the weather is like (it changes every 5 minutes here in the mountains). So occasionally I’ll be in the middle of a conversation with someone and they’ll drop out for an hour or two. I always text back, “I enjoy these little chats of ours…” after about 15 minutes or so of no response. My family seems to appreciate the dark humour, at least enough to give me a laughing face emoji or two when we reconnect…

I usually send one text “Are you still alive? lol” Then I delete all previous messages from the person. If the person is interested in talking to me again at all, he or she will respond. If I dont get a response after several days, I simply delete the number. Most of the time, I actually get a reply along the lines of “lol, yes I’m alive, silly. I’ve just been sick, busy, tired, etc.) Be patient.

What is the right you have to demand the receiver to respond to you?Don't tell me to do what you want, you have zero right for that. It is completely my decision to decide what I want to do. I know what to do and never tell me what to do.Who gave you the right to text me? Don't you feel that you are interfering my privacy by sending a text to me. How cruel you are to do that?Until the receiver is committed to you in any mode, clearly you don't have the right to demand.

I don't worry about it that much, like I did in the past. If it took her a day ( it wasn't a few days, is was one day) to text me back, I knew she wasn't really interested in me, and didn't want to be bothered. I move on from that kind of nonsense. I don't like stressing myself, if a woman is not that interested in me. I go find someone new who is interested. Don't sell yourself short on someone who's not that into you.

I personally, being an introvert do not hate texting. Rather, I find it more amusing than people bothering me with calls over small talks every now and then. You always have the option of refusing to reply a message, whereas, refusing to pick up a call sends an arrogant message to the caller.  Messaging is fast, simple, hassle-free, and definitely much low cost than making a call. So, personally I prefer messaging over calling.

I hope you are not the person who agonizes over waiting for a text reply. Some don't answer right away. Such as I only check messages a couple times a day. And if I get caught up in a demanding day or two, I might not remember your message. Just send a “what's going on? “. Two things, it's a reminder that there is an open conversation. And secondly it opens up a forum to know what is the reason for no response. Hopefully your text friend is preoccupied. Or you'll know at what frequency which friends respond and do not.

An interesting question. And it is interesting because there just may be something you are missing. Why did the individual stop talking? Could it be they have a reason you may not be privy to? I can tell you for a fact that if I stop talking there is a darn good reason for it and odds are, it isn’t a good one for the individual I was talking to. Will another text make me start talking again? No. When I have reached that point, I am done. Beating a dead horse is not going to make it move. It will serve to simply increase my resolve. I don’t know if that was the case you are referring to in your own life. But it does require one to evaluate that possibility before they further exacerbate a problem that they are not in tune with…

It really depends on how well you know the person and how much effort you want to put in. The most important thing is to maintain your own emotional wellbeing, let that determine whether you want to send them a second message or not. Full post here: What do you do when someone doesn’t reply to your messages?

You don’t text them back with anything. If they did not reply to your text, do not text them till the next time they text you and then, don’t text them back. See how they like it. I am willing not to text someone ever again. Let it be the irresistible force meeting the immovable object.There is a good saying that goes, “You want to play? LET’S PLAY!”

Obviously it depends on the circumstances and how much time has elapsed. My usual go-to snarky remark (whether text or not) is: “Or you can ignore me, that is fine too.” Some people think you are at their beck and call and should respond immediately to a text. It does not matter to them what you might be doing, you should respond immediately. That just is not realistic. With my ex that was ghosting me off and on would really annoy me. We would be in the middle of a text conversation and she would just disappear. My response was, “I hate it when you go dark on me”. Perhaps you can understand why she is an ex.

When did it become a requirement to answer text messages or indeed any message or even phone call. I only answer messages or calls if I want to. I do not answer messages or calls when I cant be bothered. It does not matter one iota who is calling or massaging me. The phone etc is there for you to contact other people when you want to and not for them to contact you.
It’s hard to say conclusively. It is possible she is: deadindisposednot interesting in conversing with youMy bet is on number 3. It is a little puzzling why you don’t see this.

Personally: I don't hate texting in general, I find it very useful in cases where I want to communicate something quickly and without any hassle. However, I do hate the pointless "what's up" conversations that serve no purpose. I'm all up for "shooting the shit" with people every once in a while, but it's really not the same over text. I'm sure others feel the same way.

Nothing? Not everyone is instantly connected to their phone first and foremost as the number 1 priority. Lol he could be busy? Getting pulled over? At work? I dated a girl once who could not resist blowing my phone text and calls if I didn’t respond RIGHT away. I had to turn my phone off, and you know what she did??? CALLED THE KITCHEN LINE!!!

Well no one ignores you. It's just a feeling. If you really think someone is ignoring you. Just go to your browser open Google start improving yourself and become successful in life and you will find that there will be queue of people waiting for you. I suggest don't ever be an option. Be yourself and enjoy your life friend. Your parents care about you make them happy 😀.

In my case it depends on the message. When someone tells you something I never reply with ok. I see it and leave it. Another scenario can be that you don't want to talk to that person so you are avoiding them. Or you reply to them late because you want to avoid the person at that time. Like if someone wants to visit you and you don't want guests you can reply late this giving the idea you were busy or sleeping.

You just have to wait. They might not be as connected to their phone as others. Or if they were provoked somehow, they might need time. Maybe they don't have much interest in people or you. There could be all kinds of reasons. If it seems serious ask in a casual way.

I’d wait awhile before doing anything. They might be busy. I think I’d wait a day if you two are used to texting frequently. If more infrequently I’d wait a couple of days. Then I’d resend the text. Maybe they didn’t get it. If no reply then, I’d drop it. They’ll get back with you when they want to communicate with you. If it’s too long, I’d reconsider whether or not I’d want to be texting this person.

When considering the cost of voice calls and the cost of text messages vs. the amount of data transfer taxing the carrier network for both communication methods, texting should cost roughly .001% of what most carriers charge for them (when compared to their average price of voice calls per minute). Given this comparison is based on arbitrary pricing, the logic holds true for most carrier plans, with the exception of the more recent, low-cost unlimited plans.

you text from a phone. Miraculously you can phone anyone and actually real life real time talk to them. But that is far too obvious. not replied to a text. Didn’t reply. Did they receive the text? If not what is the point of texting again. How do you know? call them! TALK!

Honestly I see so many questions like this. They have a life! Their schedule does not revolve around you texting! OK, obviously if you see that they read it then maybe send them another. They may not have had a chance to reply. If they are deliberately airing you then give ’em a piece of your mind.

There is no reasonable answer to this question. You mustn’t try to force someone to acknowledge you. It’s like you have a bird in a cage and they suddenly got out and through the door. You can see them in the tree in your yard, but chasing them is going to make them fly farther away. Maybe you need to coax them back in pot your life with something tasty. A reminder of something they used to enjoy when they were locked up.

I think the answer to this is based on how well you know this person. I personally hate the idea of being reachable 24/7. I will put my phone down and forget it on weekends or if I have the day off. If I know my young son is out and may need to reach me then yes I will keep my phone near me. I need space and privacy. It’s nothing personal. Simply ask this person directly and you will get your answer.

Have you considered that they are just busy, and don’t have time for non-essential communication? Not everyone likes text, if it’s important make a phone call. If it’s not important enough to do that, consider if it’s necessary. People do have lives and commitments.

Write to the person subject- Bringing to your notice unacknowledged messages. Enter the salutation, then inform her/ him nicely of the number of messages not acknowledged. List the dates and subject in descending order with cc your supervisor and her/his supervisor. If your supervisor is aware of this, copy his supervisor on the mail.

Be more patientFind/Text someone else who responds to you fasterAccept that they may be busyDo not rush a response as it is quite clingyThe person will text you when they are freeDo not text the person too much, they may get overwhelmed and your friendship will end

They are sending you a message my not communicating. if you think it’s a computer malfunction, phone them or email them, asking them to let you know they’ve received your email but don’t want to reply at present. End of discussion.

I used to kinda bug, when I got no reply. But that's so irritating, right? So now I just move on with my life. If the text was really important and you really need a reply right now. Then call instead. If they're at work or school you can leave a message in records to urgency. Otherwise... CHILL.
I have to ignore him too
Don't react, they obviously are not interested, so don't push it. Act as if it means nothing to you, don't give them the satisfaction of knowing you are concerned or upset, just move on.

Are you close to this person? Make a phone call. And if you're just a casual friend then they're under no obligation to text right back. A lot of people don't check their phones often. I almost never take my “mobile” phone out when I leave the house. Don't take it personally.

Jeez, people have to stop expecting instantaneous responses. Not everybody runs around with their device on their hip! Take some time to get to know how to best communicate with your crew, and adapt accordingly.

Well you can't text back as there's nothing to text back to. However you can either wait as they may be away or other things going on, or you can listen to the behaviour which if they have seen the text says I' don't want to talk to you' or send another text saying “sending this again as not sure if you got it ' after that don't waste anymore energy on it
Ignore them back simple as if they cant find the time reply then your not important to them your an option and that's it.

Nothing by texting back and them not replying you become annoying or come off as too needy, if they don’t reply just become busy with your life and not wait for them to reply back. If you keep texting them back and they don’t reply you come off as desperate and needy
How do you deal with people who straight up ignores your messages? Don't send any messages to them Quit worrying

Depends on the message- if it was something like good morning- then no reply back. Go on with your day. If it was something like- pick up the kids at the bus stop or something important, then a “did ya get my text” is imperative.

You ask yourself: Why aren't they responding? Maybe they are to busy, maybe they forgot, maybe they dont want to. My advice would be to give them time, try texting again in a couple of days and ask them and try and come to a conclusion with the person.

I would just re-text them. Sometimes these things get lost. I’ve seen this on my and my husband’s phones when we’ve texted each other. If you text again and don’t hear back take it as a sign they aren’t interested in talking to you.

I have one casual acquaintance who texts me semi regularly, we will have a nice chat, although her texts are usually quite short. Then I will text her something and the convewill go dead. I'm not too concerned about it, because the conversation is usually of mostly general subjects. It is just strange, especially since most of the conversations are initiated by her.
Could be many reasons: Phone battery is flatThe person is asleepTheir phone is brokenThey haven't opened their phone lately.May be having a big loooooong poopDoesn't want.to know you.Take your pick

Realize, this need to want anyone to get back to you is about you. To need to know why someone doesn’t get back to you can be for a million reasons, so choose to wonder or choose to let it be, and even if you get an answer from them that doesn’t necessarily mean that’s the truth anyway. Do what works for you, or just be ok with not knowing.

I don't text anymore.. Won't waste my time on someone who has no time for me.. It's been. 20 days since I have heard back from someone who said that I was so special. Promised he would not write me off.. Really???? I miss him but it's pointless..

You need to understand the reason for not replying. If specifically that person is furious with you or hurt by you or is trying to satisfy his/ her ego, you need to analyse and then try to hit on a weak point of that person… I hope this helps 😃.

Cry. Lol. There's only one person who is able to make me cry over that. Everyone else I do nothing. There's nothing you can do. Try calling to see if they answer. If you got transportation you could go speak in person.

Let it go. Can you? Or r u the type that allows something like this take space in ur mind n u waste energy over it? Decide… My two bits…if the person give him/her benefit of doubt were busy or whatever.just act like its nit a big deal amd know in ur heart u dont matter to them and move on…in a few months time u will b over it.

Who cares… They will SOON “God does not like Ugly”. I try to b KOOL PEOPLE HAVE NO FAITH ANYMORE. THEY JEALOUS, HATERS, BUT I TREAT PEOPLE LIKE I WANT TO BE TREATED.. Im not Worry about Ingorance.. A friend in need is a friend indeed.. The same b…ch That is the 1 Worried about what s…They doing. Me ,I follow rules.. Th
Respond with patience and full control over your emotions and ego.
I’ll get back to you.
Assume they don't have the time, ability, or interest to answer. Don't keep texting if someone doesn't answer. Frequent, unwanted texting can be considered harassing behavior.
Because when someone feels the need to text me 37 times in one day, I in turn feel the need to ignore their no-life-having, attention-seeking nonsense.
Not worry about it, if they ignore then they must have other things on their plate, I would not take it personal and would not let it screw up my day, since it’s completely out of my control
Nothing! You're putting too much emphasis on ONE person when there’s nearly 8 billion people in the world.. but you're fixated why that one wont reply? You need to not do that.
when someone ignores my text i just keep spaming hello over and over again until they replie

Get a life. Seems rude but that's the truth. Don't belittle yourself. If the person doesn't wants to talk to you why you want to go running behind them? Are you a dog looking for attention? Have some self respect.
Ignore it. If it was something really important or an emergency I would call them in the first place.
I’d get on with my life. They’re clearly not interested. I certainly would not act like a lonely fool. Keep going till you find the one who IS for you.

Wait for them to text you back. If they dont after a few days and if you think they are just ignoring you as opposed to their being ill or somewhere without a signal then I would leave them alone. It's very rude to ignore someone for no good reason.
Depends on how long it’s been, if it’s been days.. Move on.
The same way you u do to me same all do
